title: 112_s1047
content: The Act titled "Leadville Mine Drainage Tunnel Act of 2011" amends Section 703 of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 regarding tunnel maintenance and operation. The Leadville Mine Drainage Tunnel Act of 2011 amends Section 703 of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 to address tunnel maintenance, operation, and water treatment plant responsibilities. The Secretary is required to maintain the tunnel's structural integrity for public safety and prevent water release. Additionally, the Secretary is responsible for operating and maintaining the water treatment plant, with the authority to enter contracts for necessary services. The Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 is amended to include provisions for the treatment plant and drainage tunnel responsibilities. The Secretary may enter agreements for funding to improve or expand the treatment plant. The Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 allows the Secretary to enter agreements for funding to improve or expand the treatment plant, including necessary capital improvements or expansions. SEC. 4. USE OF LEADVILLE MINE DRAINAGE TUNNEL AND TREATMENT PLANT. Section 708(a) of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 is amended to address authorization, liability, and facilities covered under other laws, with an exception related to the Environmental Protection Agency's Record of Decision for operable unit 6. The Administrator must consult with the Secretary regarding any changes to the Leadville Mine Drainage Tunnel or water treatment plant in relation to a new Record of Decision for operable unit 6 of the California Gulch site. The Secretary has the authority to implement improvements to the tunnel or treatment plant based on the new decision. The Administrator must consult with the Secretary for changes to the Leadville Mine Drainage Tunnel or water treatment plant related to a new Record of Decision for operable unit 6 of the California Gulch site. The Secretary can implement improvements based on the new decision, including entering into agreements for funding. The Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 is amended to include sections 703, 705, and 707. A conforming amendment is made to the table of contents. This is part of the AN ACT passed by the Senate on December 30, 2012. To amend the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992 to improve environmental conditions near the Leadville Mine Drainage Tunnel in Lake County, Colorado.
